meanings.definition: The quality or state of being diffusive.
meanings.sent1: Her diffusiveness in sharing her toys with others made her a popular playmate.
meanings.sent2: The diffusiveness of the perfume filled the entire room with its sweet scent.
meanings.sent3: The diffusiveness of the paint on the canvas created a colorful mess that the artist had to fix.
meanings.sent4: His diffusiveness in explaining complex topics made it easier for everyone to understand.
meanings.sent5: The diffusiveness of the sunlight through the trees created a magical, dappled effect on the ground.

meanings.definition: The tendency to spread out or scatter.
meanings.sent1: The diffusiveness of the ink on the paper made the writing blurry and hard to read.
meanings.sent2: The diffusiveness of the rumors quickly reached every corner of the small town.
meanings.sent3: The diffusiveness of the glitter on the craft project made a sparkly mess on the table.
meanings.sent4: The diffusiveness of the crowd at the concert made it hard to find a clear path to the stage.
meanings.sent5: The diffusiveness of the scent from the bakery drew customers in from the street.
